title: Is it against Terms and Conditions do duo with a smurf?

replies.body: Duoing with your own smurf or someone else's? o.O

I am talking about duoing with a friend who is on their smurf but I am on my account. I wanted to know if it was against terms even if you are technically just playing with a friend. Sorry for late reply, i was busy with college
I don't know of any rules that restrict you from playing with a friend on their smurf account, currently. You should be just fine to play with your friend. :)
Thanks for the response. I appreciate it.
I matters because using somebody else's account is against the rules.

I think they meant duoing in the sense of e.g. they, on their own account, duo with their diamond buddy who is playing on a gold smurf (belonging to the diamond player). i.e. Does that count as elo boosting, or is it only when the booster directly uses the boostee's account?

(I believe boostee and booster punishments are the same, so the reverse case of if he's asking if he can use his own smurf to duo with someone should have the same answer.)

The case where he's asking if he can duo with himself (e.g. using a laptop) so both his main account and his smurf are together in the same game and he's attempting to play two champs at once...would be a weird question, since it'd basically involve 4v5 matches.
